description:
The Edge Treatment Center is a dynamic addiction recovery provider located in Santa Ana. The Edge prides itself on serving its community. We do so with a transparent, collaborative culture fueled by genuine compassion for those in recovery. Our success rate is due to the long term and community support created by our team that is empowered to adapt to the needs of the client.

We know there is no one way to recover and are dedicated to helping the client find their path. We’re out to change the addiction treatment landscape … and have fun doing it. If you feel you’re a right fit for our community, apply now!

We are seeking a dynamic and experienced Lead Case Manager for our Mental Health team. The Lead Case Manager will play a pivotal role in group, individual and family counseling at our center, ensuring the highest standards of care are maintained and innovative approaches are integrated into our programs. This position oversees Case Manager and directly manages a client caseload.

The Forge Recovery is passionate about innovative care that meets the clients needs. Every member has the ability to make the difference in a client’s recovery. If you are looking for a place to make a difference and to be better than the status quo, our team is a great fit.

Essential Duties And Responsibilities

Uphold and Enforce Standards, Policies, and Ethics

  • Ensure compliance with The Forge Recovery Center’s standards, policies, and code of ethics
  • Uphold client rights and professional conduct
  • Intervene in crisis situations as necessary

Clinical Competence

  • Demonstrate proficiency in TAP21 Counselor Competencies
  • Utilize agency assessment tools in KIPU for comprehensive client evaluations
  • Identify and prioritize patient needs and issues

Person-Centered Care Planning

  • Develop individualized care plans focusing on client-reported goals
  • Conduct therapy sessions using evidence-based practices
  • Document client progress in SOAP notes
  • Prepare effective discharge plans and transition notes

Collaboration and Communication

  • Support and train Case Managers to help them improve their skills and knowledge
  • Coordinate with health insurance for utilization reviews
  • Participate in clinical treatment team meetings
  • Provide accurate assessment and referral services
  • Communicate effectively with probation officers, lawyers, and family members

Professionalism and Compliance

  • Adhere to ethical and legal standards
  • Ensure accurate and timely clinical documentation
  • Maintain awareness of cultural competency and client satisfaction
  • Prioritize safety of staff and clients

Education, Experience, & Skills

  • Case Manager Credential. RADT minimum, CADC I, SUDCC II, CATC II or above preferred
  • 3-5+ years of Case Manager Experience
  • Passion for Client focused work and continuous improvement
  • AA or BA degree in Human Services or Behavioral Health, or equivalent experience
  • High computer literacy skills

Additional Certificates & Licenses

  • CPR/First AID
  • Valid Driver’s License

Other Requirements

  • Negative TB test results within past year
  • Medical clearance to work within past year
  • Able to work evenings when needed

Job Status: Full-Time

Location: On-site in Santa Ana

Travel: None required

Benefits

  • Medical, dental and vision insurance.
  • 401(k) plan with employer matching.
  • Paid vacation.
  • Paid sick time.
  • Paid holidays.
  • Family Leave.
  • Employer paid Life Insurance.

Salary: $27.00 - $32.00 per hour
